body: I have the same issue here.
Similarly I'm not getting any updates in any of my included .less files when doing full page refreshes unless I also make a change to my main.less.

Since Twitter released boostrap that use less (https://github.com/twitter/bootstrap ).
I think the need for this feature is more and more necessary. The setInterval hack that reaload every half second is annoying.

I've now resorted to simply blowing away the cache on every page load because I don't actually need or want caching ever for development.

https://gist.github.com/1346280
Here's a less destructive way of clearing localStorage for this reason if you're using localStorage for any other purposes besides LESS: https://gist.github.com/1346280

fast guy, mr. stoeck ;)

+1 on this!

issue.title: Don't cache during development, for watch() and refresh() to work with imports
issue.body:
When using watch with a file which has @import statements, the cache prevents automatic reloading of those imported files. I think you can assume that when in development env, and using watch, you really want to reload the file, and just skip the cache.

This should resolve both #346 and #47.

Thanks.

issue.title: modifyVars() + session_cache in v1.3.3
issue.body:
I've come to an interesting crossroads with modifyVars and I'm hoping that my comments will provide some insight (and possibly a little help for me :)).

Using 1.3.3 and attempting to change some styles via modifyVars seems to work fine in my local testbed (i.e. web server running locally and multiple *.less files). However, when I deploy to my staging server modifyVars does not seems to work quite right. What I've noticed is that in the xhr function the following line is called. 

session_cache += data.replace(/@import .+?;/ig, '');

My main.less file is essentially a bootstrapper that imports several other less files using the @imports keyword. When the line of code above is executed, the imports are stripped out, and in the modifyVars function none of the css implemented in my less files is applied following my providing the updated variables. Everything works fine when deployed as long as I do not attempt to use modifyVars().

This seems to be related to local storage, which less is not using on my localhost.

Thanks,

Corey

body: Do you have resolved this question?
